Definition: A photo, video, or audio recording acquired or used in healthcare. The actual content may be inline or provided by direct reference.

Short: Elements that belong to all information items.
Definition: Elements that belong to all information items.

Short: A human language, spoken or written.
Definition: A human language, spoken or written.

Short: A set of rules under which this content was created
Definition: A set of rules under which this content was created

Short: A human-readable narrative, potentially including images, that contains a summary of the resource, and may be used to represent the content of the resource to a human.
Definition: A human-readable narrative, potentially including images, that contains a summary of the resource, and may be used to represent the content of the resource to a human.

Short: A state that relates to the workflow or interpretation of this resource. Certain status values can modify the meaning of the resource, for example, entered-in-error. When a boolean value is used, Status of true indicates the record is active, false means inactive.
Definition: A state that relates to the workflow or interpretation of this resource. Certain status values can modify the meaning of the resource, for example, entered-in-error. When a boolean value is used, Status of true indicates the record is active, false means inactive.

Short: Business identifier or external id for this resource.
Definition: Business identifier or external id for this resource.

Short: The larger entity that the asserted item is a portion of. For example, an organization part of a larger organization, or an encounter with a hospitalist might be part of a larger hospitalization encounter.
Definition: The larger entity that the asserted item is a portion of. For example, an organization part of a larger organization, or an encounter with a hospitalist might be part of a larger hospitalization encounter.

Short: Request that caused this media to be created
Definition: Request that caused this media to be created

Short: A code describing the item at a greater level of detail.
Definition: A code describing the item at a greater level of detail.

Short: A further refinement of type.
Definition: A further refinement of type.

Short: The name of the imaging view e.g. Lateral or Antero-posterior (AP).
Definition: The name of the imaging view e.g. Lateral or Antero-posterior (AP).

Short: A choice of Patient, Practitioner, Group, Device or Specimen. These are choices for subject of Media resource.
Definition: A choice of Patient, Practitioner, Group, Device or Specimen. These are choices for subject of Media resource.

Short: The encounter or episode of care
Definition: The encounter or episode of care

Short: The time or time period that the statement addresses.
Definition:
The time or time period that the statement addresses.
The clinically relevant time is not necessarily when the information is gathered or when a test is carried out, but for example, when a specimen was collected, or the time period referred to by the question. Use a TimePeriod for a measurement or specimen collection continued over a significant period of time (e.g. 24 hour Urine Sodium).

Short: A person who practices a healing art.
Definition:
A person who practices a healing art.
HumanName is limited to one required value by US-Core. Gender is required by US-Core. US-Core required an identifier, either a NPI (preferred) or tax id.

Short: The explanation or justification for the current item or action, as a code.
Definition:
The explanation or justification for the current item or action, as a code.
Reason is a string or CodeableConcept in DSTU2 but in later versions only a CodeableConcept.

Short: A location or structure in the body, including tissues, regions, cavities, and spaces; for example, right elbow, or left ventricle of the heart. Body location is a flexible structure that allows the location to be determined by a single code, or a code plus laterality and/or orientation. The body location can also be specified in relation to one or more body landmarks. SNOMED CT is used in all cases.
Definition:
A location or structure in the body, including tissues, regions, cavities, and spaces; for example, right elbow, or left ventricle of the heart. Body location is a flexible structure that allows the location to be determined by a single code, or a code plus laterality and/or orientation. The body location can also be specified in relation to one or more body landmarks. SNOMED CT is used in all cases.
+ Code only: The code should include (precoordinate) laterality and/orientation to the degree necessary to completely specify the body location.
+ Code plus laterality and/or orientation: The basic code augmented by codes specifying the body side and/or anatomical orientation.
+ Relation to landmark: The location relative to a landmark is specified by:
- Establishing the location and type of landmark using a body site code and optional laterality/orientation, and
- Specifying the direction and distance from the landmark to the body location.
Note that BodyLocation is a data type, a reusable structure, not a stand-alone entity. The concept is similar to how a postal address can apply to a person, location, or organization. This contrasts with FHIR's stand-alone BodySite (aka BodyStructure in r4) which 'is not ... intended for describing the type of anatomical location but rather a specific body site on a specific patient' (FHIR 3.5).

Short: A specific durable physical device used in diagnosis or treatment. The value is the coding for a type of device, for example, a CPAP machine. The same device might be used on multiple patients.
Definition:
A specific durable physical device used in diagnosis or treatment. The value is the coding for a type of device, for example, a CPAP machine. The same device might be used on multiple patients.
Device status cannot be reconciled between Argonaut and US-Core, each having different required value sets.
Device type has extensible mappings to different value sets in Argonaut and US-Core, however both value sets have identical SNOMED content (descendants of 49062001 (Device). We adopt the US-Core value set, which is allowable because the binding is extensible.

Short: Height of the image in pixels (photo/video)
Definition: Height of the image in pixels (photo/video)

Short: Width of the image in pixels (photo/video)
Definition: Width of the image in pixels (photo/video)

Short: Number of frames if > 1 (photo)
Definition: Number of frames if > 1 (photo)

Short: Length in seconds (rounded to nearest whole second)
Definition: Length in seconds (rounded to nearest whole second)

Short: A file that contains audio, video, image, or similar content.
Definition: A file that contains audio, video, image, or similar content.

Short: An added or follow-up note, often after the fact, that contains metadata about who made the statement and when.
Definition: An added or follow-up note, often after the fact, that contains metadata about who made the statement and when.
